intro: Pentagonia pinnatifida, commonly known as the five-angled leaf tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive pentagonal-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in forest understories or along riverbanks. Its unique foliage makes it a popular ornamental plant in horticulture.
